title: Millennials are piling into stock trading in Asia. Here's how to make the most of your money
text: Trading platforms in Asia are seeing a strong demand from new investors. Here's how to put your money to work in investments.

title: Gundlach on Powell: 'I give him credit for talking strongly against negative interest rates'
text: DoubleLine Capital CEO Jeffrey Gundlach joins Yahoo Finance’s Julia La Roche for an exclusive, wide-ranging interview, discussing everything from the Federal Reserve, his economic outlook, and more.

title: Oil prices mixed as coronavirus spike casts shadow over U.S. demand
text: Oil prices offered up a mixed market snapshot on Monday, with Brent crude edging higher, supported by tighter supplies, while U.S. benchmark WTI futures dropped on concern that a spike in coronavirus cases could curb oil demand in the United States.

title: U.S. stock futures rise slightly as coronavirus cases continue to surge
text: U.S. stock index futures rose slightly late Sunday, ahead of Wall Street's return from a three-day holiday weekend.

title: Dollar in tight range ahead of U.S. services sector data
text: The dollar held steady against most currencies on Monday as investors awaited data expected to show the U.S. services sector stopped contracting, and highlighting the economic recovery from the coronavirus pandemic.

title: U.S. stock futures flat as coronavirus cases continue to surge
text: U.S. stock index futures were little changed late Sunday, ahead of Wall Street's return from a three-day holiday weekend.

title: U.S. Dominance In The Natural Gas Sector Is Growing
text: Last year the U.S. extended its lead over global competitors in the natural gas sector.

title: Was Q2 Too Far, Too Fast?
text: Q2 2020 ended last week with 19.95% gains. As our Strategic Trader editors, John Jagerson and Wade Hansen, note below, that is the best quarterly performance since 1998.

title: Blowout jobs report may have missed a troubling trend linked to coronavirus
text: Crossmark Global Investments' Victoria Fernandez warns the June employment numbers didn't capture the virus surge fallout.

title: Market Opens Tomorrow. Prepare For The V, ‘Ignore’ The Coronavirus
text: The coronavirus infections keep rising, but markets are focused on the following, so long as hospitals are protected.

title: The 'disconnect' between economic data and capital markets: Investment advisor
text: William Northey, U.S. Bank Wealth Management's Senior investment director, joins The Final Round to discuss the impact of COVID-19 on markets and what this means for the shape of economic recovery.

title: Can ESG Investing Beat the Market? Part 1
text: A growing number of investors are incorporating environmental, social and governance factors into their investment strategies.

title: Stock Market Update For The Week Ahead: 'Continued Strength'
text: What Happened: The S&P 500 experienced its best quarter since 1998, adding 20%. "A 20% quarterly gain is quite rare, but the catch is previous large quarterly gains have actually led to continued strength.

title: Trends with Benefits #17: Ed Lopez and Martin Fridson talk Fallen Angel High Yield Bonds
text: By Ed Lopez, Head of ETF Product, VanEck Global Many investors keeping up with financial media may have heard of “fallen angel” bonds for the first time this year. The Federal Reserve, as part of its bond buying program, allowed for the purchase of fallen angels.

title: 'No evidence' that a higher corporate tax is a positive for markets: Heritage Capital President
text: Presidential democratic candidate Joe Biden told campaign donors he plans on rolling back President Trump’s multi-trillion dollar tax cuts. Heritage Capital President Paul Schatz joins Yahoo Finance’s On The Move panel to break down the latest developments.

title: 3 Investing Rules That Can Get You Through the Next Stock Market Crash
text: Another stock market crash could be on the way. Here's how to prepare.

title: S&P PACT™ Indices: Empowering Investors Looking to Align with a 1.5°C Scenario
text: How can indices provide greater insight into climate risk and help investors looking to go beyond traditional carbon reduction strategies? Take a closer look at the drivers behind the new S&P PACT™ Indices with S&P DJI’s Jaspreet Duhra and Andrew Innes.

title: June Heatwave for Metal and Petroleum Commodities
text: The S&P GSCI rose 5.09% in June and 10.47% for the second quarter of 2020. The recovery in the second quarter did not fully retrace the dramatic downside from the first quarter, as can be seen in the index’s -36.50% YTD return.

title: Here are five charts tracking the U.S. economy amid the coronavirus pandemic
text: The United States has reported record increases in coronavirus cases with spikes seen in states well underway in their reopening progress.

title: Prices Are Going To Rise - And Fast
text: With stock markets barely ruffled, few are thinking beyond the very short term and they are mostly guessing anyway.

title: Consumer confidence sees biggest rise since 2011
text: Conference Board Chief Economist Bart Van Ark joins Yahoo Finance’s Brian Sozzi and Jared Blikre to break down the latest consumer confidence index.

title: Another Deadly Virus Could Be on the Way. Should You Change How You're Investing?
text: The good news: Nothing to worry about yet. The bad news: The good news includes the word "yet".
